column5: Whiteout here for the past 2 hrs or so, no signs of it letting up anytime soon.
me too  thats my security camera but nothing compared to the Tang

Here's what I ran into this afternoon near Mitchell on my way to work.  Visibility near zero. Turned back and went home.  That seems about right for Mitchell area on a day like today... I delivered bread there 6 days a week for 14yrs, days like today I don't miss it at all.
Looks like The area NW-SE of Lake Simcoe is supposed to get that kind of snow Blaque according to this computer model.    Drifter great graphic. What website is this from?
Well it's piling on here, can't see across the street every now and then, might be a snow day tomorrow.
Terry,  just got a video from my daughter who lives a couple km west of the park and it doesn't look pretty up there! Not looking good at all.
could be an interesting morning
Anyone else betting on another intense winter??....Well, with Drifter it's a given haha.
We could use some snow so I can get the sled out.

It may be a dicy one for sure Rod. Started way too early but then they are calling for 8 on Monday down here. So far in Woody we have only had a 'dusting'.  I warned them about what they  may expect when they bought the place. I Spent too many days on Simcoe in the winter to know.
Come and get Dave!  http://weather.gc.ca/radar/index_e.html?id=WKR
Looks like Barrie was on the ball for this one. Streets are cleared .

Looks like Barrie was on the ball for this one. Streets are cleared .  Yeah, clear when I got up this morning, although lastnight I saw so many cars try to get up a hill by my house, it was almost comical, lol!!!
Yeah, clear when I got up this morning, although lastnight I saw so many cars try to get up a hill by my house, it was almost comical, lol!!!  Video?
time to brap!
NOW THATS FUNNY!!!!!

We've had constant lake effect snow since Saturday night. Thankfully, a lot of it melts down during the day.  But... it's not stopping. On the plus side, the neighbours in Buffalo are gonna get clobbered.
http://www.syracuse.com/news/index.ssf/2014/11/dangerous_lake_effect_snow_blizzard_lake_ontario.html  Western New York might not be a good destination!
100 cm or more has fallen here so far. Been a record setting November. It's been brutal! http://m.sootoday.com/content/news/details.aspx?c=81596.

gotta get my wifes size fer a new sno-shovel  LOL a guy my father worked with was out at CTC one night with his wife, when we ran into them... She was trying different shovels and he kept saying, "MAKE sure you are comfortable USING it, it is your job to clear the snow ya know, you just had to move here to Canada from Holland didn't you".... We just cracked up.

LOL a guy my father worked with was out at CTC one night with his wife, when we ran into them... She was trying different shovels and he kept saying, "MAKE sure you are comfortable USING it, it is your job to clear the snow ya know, you just had to move here to Canada from Holland didn't you".... We just cracked up.
75-80 km/hr gusts and squalls for us tomorrow.  think i'm working from home.
With the snow coming off the open lake,won't be long before folks in the Soo are tunneling out to the street. I remember a couple of winters with 10-12' snow banks back in the 80's

With the snow coming off the open lake,won't be long before folks in the Soo are tunneling out to the street. I remember a couple of winters with 10-12' snow banks back in the 80's  AHHH!!! Those were the good old days weren't they? I remember on snowstorm in the 80's in Mississauga where we had 10' drifts in the driveway. Spent 10 hours shovelling and still didn't have it cleared before the old man got home after work.

100 cm or more has fallen here so far. Been a record setting November. It's been brutal! http://m.sootoday.com/content/news/details.aspx?c=81596. I left north bay at 930am, arrived in White River at 830pm. Should have been a 7hr drive. Closed hwy's, jacknifed tractor trailers, people doing 20km/hr,  tractor trailers all over steep hills. Holy crap this area is getting hammered!!
Safe travels home to you man
You are gonna get BLASTED tomorrow!  I'll be working on the highway between white river and wawa tomorrow, then off to timmins, then home. At least I won't be at the business end of a Lake S wind!
Ahhh... No biggie...keeps me climatized for northern Ontario steel heading! No, your right we are gonna get blasted lol Again, safe driving man
It sure isn't looking too promising for extended clear skies for the next little while for a wide area around the Great Lakes.  http://www.intellicast.com/National/Radar/Current.aspx
Be safe Tyler, sounds nasty up there!

A friend is leaving Thursday and driving to BC where he has a winter home in the mountains. He crosses at the Soo and then heads across the northern States. Sounds like he could run into some pretty nasty weather along the way.

http://www.syracuse.com/news/index.ssf/2014/11/dangerous_lake_effect_snow_blizzard_lake_ontario.html  Western New York might not be a good destination!  It aint purdy, i posted a few pics in a new thread
Looks like The area NW-SE of Lake Simcoe is supposed to get that kind of snow Blaque according to this computer model.
EESH.......thats an ugly looking map lol
I'm about 25 km NW of Alliston and it is ugly out there right now !!!
Here's what I ran into this afternoon near Mitchell on my way to work.  Visibility near zero. Turned back and went home.
Yikes. You got winters on your Jeep?  This was yesterday on Hwy 17 as they closed down a section to move some jacknifed tractor trailers. Gotta hate being the first guy stopped!
Just let the dogs out ,must be 6" now at my back door.
Terry... too scared to even go outside.. booo hooo Dave... 6"....

It's really coming down just outside of North Bay. We have nearly 1.5 feet on the ground right now. Roads are brutal. Any body else getting dumped on?  This won't help in the making of the first few inches of ice. With the very high water this falland all this snow, it's going to be one of those years where extra care will be needed when venturing onto lakes with little to no traffic.

It's really coming down just outside of North Bay. We have nearly 1.5 feet on the ground right now. Roads are brutal. Any body else getting dumped on?  This won't help in the making of the first few inches of ice. With the very high water this falland all this snow, it's going to be one of those years where extra care will be needed when venturing onto lakes with little to no traffic. I've pointed the big fan Northward, keep your snow, we had about a foot here on Friday.  Fortunately most has packed down to about 4 inches now.
Just wait until we retaliate with a huge air conditioner and give you a week of -40!
I've been plowing since Thursday.... time to move to Arizona !
I don't want anymore until Thurs, that's when I get the winter tires, almost got stuck going to work on Fri. really don't need to do that again  Maureen
Winter-tire time sneaks up quick eh!  I got the winters/studs on my wife's car JUST in time. Our dirt roads are the worst I've seen them.
guess I need to put gas in the new snowblower..damn not ready for winter yet me not the blower
Hopefully the Tundra is gased up and ready to ride, post some pics
We're just getting our 1st dusting of snow now but I put the winter tires on the truck today.

gave our road the first scrapping of the year with my quad this morning, then we tried to get the new (to us) snow plow truck going, ended up putting a tarp over the engine compartment and putting my little buddy heater under the engine to warm it up . once we got it started, we had a rough time getting it into reverse, so I guess once we give it a going over in the garage and get the snow plow out of the box of the truck and installed we would be ready for the really heavy snow .
we skipped snow and just got cold lol. we have half an inch or so but shes been around -15/-20 already

Me and Joey took the machines out for a run today. The tundra and the old bravo ran great! Will post some pics for sure, I keep meaning to do that but it's dark now and I gotta travel this week.  grt1, sounds like a long driveway or a very rural road!
I thought Joey was team Polaris? Bravo LT?

He has a Polaris 550 two -up that wouldn't turn over today...yikes. Probably ice, I hope. He just showed me his new 1990 Safari, now THAT is a reliable sled.  I have the tundra and my brothers Bravo (I think it's LT). The tundra is in great shape, the bravo runs good but is in rough shape. Reminds me of Ricky's car on trailer park boys.
Im about 120 miles east from you and we have just a dusting of snow here and were suppose to get a max of 5cm today.
Heard on the news this morning that the Barrie area could get an additional 50 cm by the end of this week.
Sweet, I'm glad I got the snowblower out of the basement yesterday    Not much snow today, just a few cms so far.  I love this weather!
And that might be just a dusting ....compared to some idiot that lives on the escarpement overlooking the "gap" !
Getting a bit here in Woodbridge, problem is its been falling all day. Yuck is the driving ever bad.
Basement? Seems like a strange place to store a gas powered snow blower?  G
Basement? Seems like a strange place to store a gas powered snow blower?  G  Walkout basement.  I can't imagine hauling that thing up and down stairs
Ok makes sense! I was thinking the same thing, how in the hell would I get mine in and out lol  G
I'm glad my girlfriend enjoys the workout shoveling the driveway.  Don't think I even shoveled once last year.
gotta get my wifes size fer a new sno-shovel
We got 3-5 inches here, it started early in the morning, our first recordable snow here, 15 miles or so north of us they have been dealing with it for a week or so.
